title: Weekly Digest: Software Invades Sports, AI Rounds Explode, and Fresh VC Capital Floods In
subtitle: January ecosystem highlights â€” AI momentum, mega funding rounds, VC power moves, acquisitions, and must-watch interviews.
author: Ollie Forsyth
content_html:
Subscribe now

This week alone, startups raised billions, AI companies pushed past $4.5B valuations, and software brands quietly began locking up the world’s biggest sports teams.

To help you make sense of it all, we’ve rounded up the most talked-about startup stories from the past week — broken down into these categories:

  • 🔔 The latest trend

  • 🗝️ Read of the week

  • 🔍 Top tech news

  • 💰 Startup funding news

  • 👀 New VC funds

  • 🤝 Acquisitions

  • 🎤 Must-watch interviews

Let’s dive in 🚀

Brought to you by Framer

Launch fast. Design beautifully. Build your startup on Framer — free for your first year.

First impressions matter. With Framer, early-stage founders can launch a beautiful, production-ready site in hours. No dev team, no hassle. Join hundreds of YC-backed startups that launched here and never looked back.

  • One year free: Save $360 with a full year of Framer Pro, free for early-stage startups.

  • No-code, no delays: Launch a polished site in hours, not weeks, without hiring developers.

  • Built to grow: Scale your site from MVP to full product with CMS, analytics, and AI localization.

Apply to claim your free year -->

🔔 The latest trend

I posted a few months ago about a mega interesting trend that is happening right now…

Young(ish) software companies are entering sports as brand partners and many more have entered the race since my last post with the latest being 👇

Deel → Premier League with Arsenal Football Club

Revolut → F1 with Audi F1

ElevenLabs → F1 with Audi F1

Airwallex → F1 with McLaren Racing

Spotify → FC Barcelona

Shopify → Shopify Racing powered by TWOth

Nexo → F1 with Audi F1

Why this is worth watching:

1) Instant global brand recognition.

2) Borrowed trust from the world’s biggest teams.

3) A very public signal to competitors.

4) This is a land grab — once these partnerships are taken, latecomers are locked out.

Expect many more still-young software companies to enter sports in 2026.

🗝️ Read of the week: The AI Design Playbook for Startups

Four frameworks every startup needs before embedding AI into their product — because AI is rewriting the rules of product strategy, but the teams breaking out aren’t the ones chasing the newest model.

NEW ECONOMIES
The AI Design Playbook for Startups
This week, we’re going deeper into a question every founder is wrestling with right now: how do you design AI into your product in a way that creates real competitive advantage — not gimmicks but durable differentiation…
Read more
24 days ago · 21 likes · 2 comments · Rupa Chaturvedi

🔍 Top tech news

  • Upwind raised $250M led by Bessemer Venture Partners at a $1.5B valuation to continue building ‘runtime’ cloud security.

  • Standard Nuclear raised $140M led by Decisive Point as nuclear power enters its gold rush era.

  • The Sidemen, one of the biggest creator groups, have announced the launch of Sidemen Productions, a new creator-led production company.

💰 Startup funding news

  • Redwood Materials raised $425M Series E led by Eclipse as AI power needs rise.

  • Checkbox raised $23M Series A led by Touring Capital to become the front door for in-house legal teams.

  • Aikido Security raised $60M Series B led by DST Global, at a $1B valuation to unify application security.

  • Decagon raised $250M Series D led by Coatue and Index Ventures pegging the company to a $4.5B valuation.

  • Brickanta raised $8M Seed led by Northzone for AI construction tools.

  • As vet bills jump 40% in recent years, startup Snout raised $110M Series A ($10M Venture & $100M Debt) for its ‘membership’ model to defray costs.

  • Zocks raised $45M Series B from Lightspeed, to become the AI assistant for financial advisors.

  • Matic is reimagining the next generation of fully autonomous, helpful, and elegant home robots has raised $60M as per the co-founders’ announcement today.

  • Mesh has officially entered the fintech unicorn club after raising $75M in a Series C funding round led by Dragonfly.

  • Rogo raised $75M Series C led by Sequoia to scale AI finance platform.

  • Outtake, a cyber startup that works with OpenAI, AppLovin and Bill Ackman’s Pershing Square, raised $40M Series B led by ICONIQ.

👀 New VC funds

  • Voyager Ventures, an early-stage VC firm investing across Europe and the US, has closed its third fund at $275m.

  • b2venture closes €150M Fund V to back Europe’s next-Gen tech leaders.

  • Daphni closes €260m early-stage fund for science-first deeptech startups.

  • VC firm 2150 raises €210M fund to solve cities’ climate challenges.

🤝 Acquisitions

  • Apple acquires Israeli audio AI startup Q.ai.

  • AI data-labeling startup Handshake has acquired data label-auditing startup Cleanlab.

🎤 Must-watch interviews

  • Andreessen Horowitz General Partner: Venture Capital’s Future | David Haber.

  • He Built A $1.8B AI Company With No Experience | Max Junestrand.

  • Forget AI: Inside the Meltdown That Made Airalo #1 eSIM Unicorn | Ahmet Bahadir Ozdemir.

  • The Hidden Skill Behind Every Successful Founder | Lindsay Kaplan.

  • The Harsh Truth About Building a Startup in the AI Era | Anish Acharya.

  • The AI Version of You Will Outperform You — Emad Mostaque.

  • How Solana Survived When Most Other Coins Fell | Anatoly Yakovenko.

Watch now!
